page.title: 19LAW AND ORDER
page.content: { LAW AND ORDER St. Keverne Parish has a policeman who lives in the village. He is available 24 hours a day. There is constant contact between the villagers and the 'bobby'. He is involved in the village committees and the Parish Council activities. Most crimes in this area are of the 'petty' variety. Sometimes his work is outside of the parish. He assists as a reserve with Coast Guards, Life boat and the Fire Brigade. St. Keverne is lucky enough to have a station manned by local volunteers. The Firemen are contacted by 'alerters'. The Health Centre with two doctors can deal with minor ailments and burns but the nearest hospital is in Truro. Our local 'bobby' has been with us for five years and is a well established member of the community.
